core_pathology: Basal ganglia dopamine depletion → motor execution deficit
prevalence_of_speech_disorder: 70-90% of PD patients across disease course

acoustic_phonatory.name: Jitter (local, %)
acoustic_phonatory.definition: Cycle-to-cycle variation in fundamental frequency period

acoustic_phonatory.name: Jitter (absolute, us)
acoustic_phonatory.definition: Absolute period-to-period F0 variation in microseconds

acoustic_phonatory.name: Jitter (RAP)
acoustic_phonatory.definition: Relative Average Perturbation — 3-point period perturbation

acoustic_phonatory.name: Jitter (PPQ5)
acoustic_phonatory.definition: 5-point Period Perturbation Quotient

acoustic_phonatory.name: Jitter (DDP)
acoustic_phonatory.definition: Average absolute difference of differences of consecutive periods / average period

acoustic_phonatory.name: Shimmer (local, %)
acoustic_phonatory.definition: Cycle-to-cycle variation in amplitude

acoustic_phonatory.name: Shimmer (local, dB)
acoustic_phonatory.definition: Shimmer in decibels

acoustic_phonatory.name: Shimmer (APQ3)
acoustic_phonatory.definition: 3-point Amplitude Perturbation Quotient

acoustic_phonatory.name: Shimmer (APQ5)
acoustic_phonatory.definition: 5-point Amplitude Perturbation Quotient

acoustic_phonatory.name: Shimmer (APQ11)
acoustic_phonatory.definition: 11-point Amplitude Perturbation Quotient

acoustic_phonatory.name: Shimmer (DDA)
acoustic_phonatory.definition: Average absolute difference of differences of consecutive amplitudes / average amplitude

acoustic_phonatory.name: HNR (Harmonics-to-Noise Ratio, dB)
acoustic_phonatory.definition: Ratio of harmonic energy to noise energy

acoustic_phonatory.name: NHR (Noise-to-Harmonics Ratio)
acoustic_phonatory.definition: Inverse of HNR — proportion of noise

acoustic_phonatory.name: F0 Mean (Hz)
acoustic_phonatory.definition: Average fundamental frequency

acoustic_phonatory.name: F0 Standard Deviation (Hz)
acoustic_phonatory.definition: Variation in F0 across utterance

acoustic_phonatory.name: F0 Range (semitones)
acoustic_phonatory.definition: Distance between F0 max and min

acoustic_phonatory.name: PPE (Pitch Period Entropy)
acoustic_phonatory.definition: Entropy of F0 period distribution — measures pitch regularity

acoustic_phonatory.name: RPDE (Recurrence Period Density Entropy)
acoustic_phonatory.definition: Nonlinear measure of signal periodicity

acoustic_phonatory.name: DFA (Detrended Fluctuation Analysis)
acoustic_phonatory.definition: Fractal scaling exponent of F0 signal

acoustic_phonatory.name: D2 (Correlation Dimension)
acoustic_phonatory.definition: Complexity measure from attractor reconstruction

acoustic_phonatory.name: CPP (Cepstral Peak Prominence, dB)
acoustic_phonatory.definition: Prominence of cepstral peak — measures voice clarity

acoustic_phonatory.name: GNE (Glottal-to-Noise Excitation Ratio)
acoustic_phonatory.definition: Ratio of glottal excitation energy to noise

acoustic_phonatory.name: H1-H2 (dB)
acoustic_phonatory.definition: Difference between first and second harmonic amplitudes — breathiness index

acoustic_phonatory.name: OQ (Open Quotient)
acoustic_phonatory.definition: Proportion of glottal cycle where folds are open

acoustic_phonatory.name: Vocal Tremor Frequency (Hz)
acoustic_phonatory.definition: Dominant frequency of amplitude/frequency modulation

acoustic_phonatory.name: Vocal Tremor Amplitude
acoustic_phonatory.definition: Depth of modulation of vocal tremor

acoustic_phonatory.name: Voice Breaks (count/duration)
acoustic_phonatory.definition: Number and duration of F0 breaks

acoustic_phonatory.name: Degree of Voicelessness (%)
acoustic_phonatory.definition: Percentage of unvoiced frames in sustained phonation

articulatory.name: Vowel Space Area (VSA, Hz^2)
articulatory.definition: Triangular area in F1-F2 space for corner vowels /a/, /i/, /u/
articulatory.extraction: corner vowels in words or isolated

articulatory.name: F2 Range (Hz)
articulatory.definition: Total range of F2 across connected speech

articulatory.name: F2 Slope (Hz/ms)
articulatory.definition: Rate of formant transition between vowels and consonants

articulatory.name: Voice Onset Time (VOT, ms)
articulatory.definition: Time between plosive release and voicing onset
articulatory.pd_abnormality: Variable: may be shortened or show higher variability

articulatory.name: Spirantization Index
articulatory.definition: Degree to which stop consonants become fricative-like

articulatory.name: Imprecise Consonant Ratio
articulatory.definition: Proportion of consonants with reduced closure or frication

articulatory.name: DDK Regularity (CV)
articulatory.definition: Coefficient of variation of DDK intervals

articulatory.name: Plosive Gap Duration (ms)
articulatory.definition: Duration of silence during stop consonant closure

articulatory.name: MFCC (1-13)
articulatory.definition: Mel-Frequency Cepstral Coefficients — spectral envelope of vocal tract
articulatory.extraction: any speech segment, openSMILE or librosa

prosodic.name: Hypophonia (reduced SPL)
prosodic.extraction: sustained vowel + connected speech, calibrated mic

prosodic.name: Pitch Declination Slope
prosodic.definition: Rate of F0 decline across an utterance

prosodic.name: Stress Pattern Regularity
prosodic.definition: Acoustic marking of stressed vs unstressed syllables

prosodic.name: Phrase-Final Lengthening
prosodic.definition: Duration increase of final syllable in phrase

prosodic.name: Spectral Slope (dB/octave)
prosodic.definition: Rate of spectral energy decrease with frequency

temporal_fluency.name: Speech Rate (syllables/sec)
temporal_fluency.definition: Number of syllables per second including pauses

temporal_fluency.name: Percent Pause Time (%)
temporal_fluency.definition: Proportion of total time spent in pauses

temporal_fluency.name: Festination
temporal_fluency.definition: Progressive acceleration within an utterance ending in mumbling or freeze

temporal_fluency.name: Palilalia
temporal_fluency.definition: Involuntary repetition of words/phrases with increasing rate and decreasing loudness

motor_speech_control.name: Laryngeal Timing Deficits
motor_speech_control.definition: Coordination between respiratory, phonatory, and articulatory systems
motor_speech_control.mechanism: Impaired inter-subsystem coordination via basal ganglia

motor_speech_control.name: Respiratory Support Deficits
motor_speech_control.definition: Subglottal pressure and airflow management during speech
motor_speech_control.mechanism: Chest wall rigidity + reduced respiratory drive

motor_speech_control.name: Vocal Fold Bowing
motor_speech_control.definition: Shape of vocal folds during phonation

motor_speech_control.name: Glottal Incompetence
motor_speech_control.definition: Failure of vocal folds to fully close during phonation

motor_speech_control.name: Hypernasality
motor_speech_control.definition: Excessive nasal resonance from incomplete velopharyngeal closure
motor_speech_control.mechanism: Velopharyngeal incompetence from reduced velum elevation

pd_vs_alzheimers.key_principle: PD degrades the ACOUSTIC SIGNAL (motor output) while preserving LANGUAGE CONTENT. AD degrades LANGUAGE CONTENT while preserving the ACOUSTIC SIGNAL.

pd_vs_depression.key_principle: Both show reduced prosody, but PD has MOTOR markers absent in depression.

pd_vs_essential_tremor.key_principle: Both produce vocal tremor but with different characteristics.
pd_vs_essential_tremor.pd_unique: Full hypokinetic dysarthria profile (hypophonia, imprecise consonants, reduced VSA)

recommended_recording_protocol.features: jitter, shimmer, HNR, NHR, PPE, RPDE, DFA, CPP, GNE, vocal tremor
all prosodic, connected speech articulation, pause patterns, speech rate
